AIRBNB Arbitrage: Get the landlord to say YES

Airbnb arbitrage is a blessing for people who don’t own a property but still want to make money via short-term rental.

The concept of leveraging someone else’s property and subleasing it to your daily guests removes one of the biggest roadblocks in your journey with Airbnb.

However, to truly succeed in this venture, you need to get the landlords on your side, including — pitching your business model effectively, getting a positive ‘yes’, and negotiating a favorable rental deal.

This blog will guide you through the entire process, providing tips, strategies, and a sample script to help you get started with properties for Airbnb arbitrage.

[Get on Airbnb by getting some cash upfront through signing up using my link https://www.airbnb.co.in/r/prekshac79?s=6&t=061n0g]

A YES to your new business..

Getting landlords on board with your plan is crucial if you want to build a rental arbitrage business.

  • The landlord’s consent is of utmost importance, you cannot legally sublease the property on Airbnb. Their approval is the cornerstone of your business model.
  • A landlord who likes you will offer you better and longer rental deals. Your stress at the time of renewing the lease will be less if you have a good partnership.
  • And this 1 landlord can potentially bring in more properties, just by referral

How to approach

When approaching landlords, you are essentially selling them on the idea of letting them sublease their property. You need to show:

  • WHY they should sublease, and
  • Why should they sublease TO YOU

This means an amalgamation of benefits of short-term rental for the landlords that will go over and beyond steady income + your unique style in guaranteeing those benefits to them.

  1. Letting go of the worry of finding new tenants: One of the biggest concerns of property owners can be a vacant property. Present your business as a long-term proposition to answer that worry.
  2. Maintenance of the property: As a good property manager whose entire business depends on the property's well-being, a potential landlord can be convinced that their property will be maintained.
  3. Property appreciation: Real estate with a good short-term rental history can attract potential buyers when positioned well. If the demand goes up, the property can appreciate, thus bringing in additional returns for the owner.

A good Airbnb host will explain why s/he is an awesome tenant for the owner by performing well.

A sample script

Here are some pointers you can include in your pitch to potential landlords.

“Hello [Landlord’s Name],

My name is [Your Name], and I’m a local property manager with extensive experience in short-term rentals. I’m reaching out because I’m interested in leasing your property [Property Address] and would like to discuss an exciting opportunity that can benefit both of us.

I specialize in managing properties for short-term rentals through platforms like Airbnb. This model not only guarantees you a steady and reliable rental income but also ensures that your property is well-maintained and cared for. Unlike traditional tenants, we conduct regular cleanings and maintenance checks to keep the property in top condition.

Here’s how this can be beneficial for you:

  1. Consistent Income
  2. Professional Management
  3. Property Care
  4. <Other value propositions>

I understand you might have concerns about subleasing. We ensure that all guests are thoroughly vetted and we have a strict no-party policy. Additionally, we carry liability insurance to cover any potential damages, giving you peace of mind.

I’d love to discuss this opportunity further and address any questions you may have. When would be a convenient time for you to meet or have a call?”

Now this is not a one-size-fits-all area. Every landlord is different; no two will be convinced by saying this pitch out loud. You need to curate your style specific to the landlord’s needs while approaching them

Negotiating the Rental Deal

Once the property owner agrees to your proposal, the next step will be negotiating the rental deal to suit best for both of you.

Here you will aim to create a win-win situation. Talk about:

  • Rent Adjustments
  • Lease terms
  • Services

But make sure you don’t end up trying to grab everything in your favor. An effective deal only works when both parties feel comfortable.

Your USP

Now if you want to stand out from other potential renters and make the owner go “s/he is the perfect person for my property”, you need to highlight your unique points. It can be:

  1. Your extensive experience in the industry
  2. Your professionalism
  3. Your areas of expertise [Marketing, Finance], or
  4. The additional services you can provide

You can demonstrate your value to the landlord and negotiate a more favorable rental deal by showcasing your unique points.

In Conclusion..

Airbnb arbitrage requires a combination of salesmanship, negotiation skills, and the ability to build trust with wary property landlords. You need to convince them of the potential of this business model, address their concerns, and negotiate effectively.

Through a structured approach, you will be able to build a successful Airbnb venture. Remember, the key is to provide value, ensuring a win-win situation for both parties.

BEST properties in India [for AIRBNB]

When done correctly, running an Airbnb can be quite lucrative.

Yes, it is about hospitality — customer satisfaction, housekeeping, convenience to guests, etc.

But the real estate you do your Airbnb on also plays a major role in the performance of your business.

Therefore, analyzing potential properties is crucial in ensuring a successful Airbnb venture.

[Get on Airbnb by getting some cash upfront through signing up using my link https://www.airbnb.co.in/r/prekshac79?s=6&t=061n0g]

This blog post will help you evaluate good properties for your Airbnb business, considering factors such as location, amenities, and potential for profitability.

Potential of Airbnb in India

The Airbnb market in India is currently severely under-tapped.

According to a report by RedSeer Consulting, the Indian vacation rental market, which includes Airbnb, is expected to reach a market size of $2.3 billion by 2025, with a CAGR of 19%.

This growth potential makes it an attractive option for aspiring hosts looking to capitalize on the increasing demand for short-term rentals.

Market Analysis

The first step before getting on the Airbnb bandwagon is to decide the market where you want to start this business. For that, you must understand the market dynamics of a location. Key factors to consider:

  1. DEMAND AND SUPPLY

a. Trends: Does the market have a high tourist influx? Or is the city a base for business travelers? From the STR perspective, these data points make places such as Goa or Bengaluru promising places.

b. Seasonality: A tourist-dependent state such as Goa/Himachal has a seasonal cycle of visitors. This affects the occupancy rate which is the base factor in an Airbnb. Analyze the peak and off-peak seasons.

c. Competition: Research the existing Airbnb listings in the area and their profitability — High competition might mean a saturated market, but it also indicates strong demand.

2. LOCAL REGULATIONS

Running an Airbnb in Goa is legal and even encouraged by the tourism department, but you must have a tourism license. Research the local laws regarding short-term rentals. Some cities have restrictions or require specific licenses to operate an Airbnb.

Also, ensure compliance with taxation policies. Income from Airbnb rentals is subject to taxation under the Indian Income Tax Act.

Resources regarding legal and tax requirements can be found on the official site of Airbnb.

3. RENTAL RATES

Research the average nightly rates for similar properties as yours in the area to determine a competitive price point. Consider factors such as seasonality, local events, and holidays that may impact demand and pricing.

Rental rates play a big part in determining your Airbnb's rental yield [or ROI].

Property Analysis

After narrowing down to a market, you must scout for a suitable property. While there is no “best” property type, certain options can give better returns for long-term growth.

Here’s what to look for:

  1. LOCATION: Well-connected and accessible properties have higher occupancy. Proximity to major attractions, transportation hubs, and business districts is crucial.
  2. CONDITION AND FEATURES: Assess the property’s condition and estimate the cost of any necessary repairs or renovations. Consider the ongoing maintenance costs, such as cleaning, laundry, and utilities. Also, look for essential amenities such as wifi, air conditioning, and additional perks for guests like a pool/gym which can be marketed as selling points.
  3. SOCIETY RULES AND SECURITY: In Goa, you need a separate NOC from the society if your property is a part of a gated community. If it is independent, you must ensure that the property has adequate safety features, such as smoke detectors, fire extinguishers, and secure locks.

Operational Analysis

Once you’ve selected a property, examine the following operational aspects:

  1. HOUSEKEEPING AND MANAGEMENT ON GROUND: Your property needs to be ready on time for every guest. To ensure this, you need to have trustworthy housekeeping staff who keep a check on the cleanliness and are available in case of emergencies.
  2. PRICING STRATEGY: You must develop a dynamic pricing strategy that adjusts rates based on demand, seasonality, and local events. Use tools like Airbnb’s Smart Pricing or third-party pricing software to optimize your rates.
  3. GUEST COMMUNICATION: From sharing the check-in details to answering their requirements during the stay, you need to maintain clear and prompt communication with guests. Positive interactions can lead to better reviews and repeat bookings.
  4. MARKETING AND GUEST REVIEWS: Post a guest stay, actively manage your Airbnb listing by responding to guest reviews, addressing concerns, and continuously improving your property and services based on feedback.

In Conclusion..

Whether buying a new property or doing rental arbitrage, investing in Airbnb in India can be a profitable venture if approached strategically. Conduct thorough market analysis, choose the right property, and manage operations effectively to maximize your success.

The above factors can increase your chances of success as an Airbnb host in India.

items.title: Airbnb without owning Property: Rental Arbitrage
items.author: Preksha Chand
items.description:
Want to get into the Airbnb world quickly but don’t have a property yet?

It is fine, you can take leverage of someone else’s property [with consent of course].

That sounds illegal...
NOT AT ALL! Airbnb arbitrage lets you get all the benefits of running your short-term rental without investing a single note in buying real estate.

[Get on Airbnb by getting some cash upfront through signing up using my link https://www.airbnb.co.in/r/prekshac79?s=6&t=061n0g]

The model is quite simple.

All you have to do is:

  • Approach an owner looking for a tenant
  • Tell him “I am going to pay you rent, and I'm going to be the best tenant you ever have. You will get more rent and not worry about finding another occupant.”
  • “But I will sublease your property on a short-term rental basis; on Airbnb or other platforms. Don’t worry all the management will be done by me and your property will be looked after”
  • The money left after deducting all the expenses from the revenue of this business [rent, utilities. housekeeping] will be YOUR PROFITs

And voila! You get additional income without the need to own the property outright. Pretty cool right?

Let’s explore the nitty-gritty..

What are your responsibilities?

In doing rental arbitrage, you must have a knack of:

  • Finding GOOD properties to rent: Identify properties with landlords who allow subletting and negotiate a favorable long-term lease.
  • Preparing the property for subleasing: Invest in furnishings [if unfurnished], decor, and amenities to make the property attractive for short-term rentals.
  • Listing and marketing it on platforms: Create a compelling listing, set competitive prices, and market it on social media to get guests [and later reviews]
  • Managing bookings and operations: Ensure the property is well-maintained, and cleaned between guests, and any issues are promptly addressed.

That’s it? Then even I can start earning extra cash from today only..

Well sure, but to run this model successfully, you must have the necessary skills.

Who can get the best of it?

Rental arbitrage can best benefit individuals with:

  1. Strong negotiation skills: 2 decisions will decide your revenue turnaround — How favorable are your lease terms from landlords and at how much are you further renting to guests? Both these decisions require you to negotiate deals that are win-win for all
  2. Interior design skills: Airbnbs are all about catching the attention of guests and making them comfortable at your property. This requires knowledge about interior design that has good aesthetics + is cozy.
  3. Marketing: The more your business is talked about, the more clients you’ll get. Marketing is quintessential if you want to have a higher revenue inflow and get more occupancy
  4. Excellent communication and customer service: The Airbnb game is a hospitality service and guest experience is paramount. You must answer their needs before they raise them — this is just a small way to maintain positive reviews [and help in marketing your property through word-of-mouth]
  5. Time management: Time is crucial when running an Airbnb — responding to guest inquiries, managing the mixups, and coordinating cleanings will decide whether you will get guests interested in your stay.

Where to do Rental Arbitrage?

Airbnb subleasing can work well in places where the potential of the Airbnb market is high. To choose the market, you must look at factors such as:

  1. Short-term rental demand: Areas with high tourist traffic [with popular attractions] or corporate housing scope will perform best.
  2. Rental rates: The potential Airbnb rental income should exceed the lease payments and expenses. Choose an area where rental rates work in your favor.
  3. Local regulations: Each city/state has different short-term rental laws and regulations. Make sure you comply with them to avoid unnecessary tension.

Should you do Airbnb Arbitrage?

Now that the process of Rental arbitrage is clear — and you seem more than interested in the opportunity, you must understand why to do it AND why to NOT do it.

That is the pros and cons list.

PROS:

  1. No property ownership costs: You avoid the expenses of purchasing and maintaining a property.
  2. Flexibility: You can easily scale up or down by renting additional properties or terminating leases.
  3. Potential for higher returns: Most importantly, you can earn way more from short-term rentals than from long-term leases.

CONS:

  1. Lease restrictions: Some landlords may prohibit subletting or have strict rules about short-term rentals.
  2. Financial risk: If occupancy rates are low or expenses are high, you may struggle to cover lease payments.
  3. Time-consuming: Managing multiple properties, coordinating cleanings, and handling guest inquiries can be time-intensive.

So you can see, rental arbitrage can be a lucrative business model for those with the right skills, in the right market, and with the right resources.

It is essential to carefully evaluate the risks, comply with local regulations, and maintain quality service to ensure long-term success.

What to know BEFORE you become an Airbnb host

A year ago, I became an Airbnb host in South Goa.

Akshat Shrivastava had just bought a property — and knowing the potential of short-term rentals in Goa, I offered to rent it from him at 40% more than the standard rent.

What was my plan? To sublease it on Airbnb [with his permission] and make at least 20% in profits.

Today, in 2024…
- Akshat is earning approximately an 8% rental yield on his property, AND
- I have made 40% in profits!

The concept of Airbnb is working out pretty decent :)

Now if this sounds like a good $$$ making hustle and makes you want to rent your place on Airbnb right away, there are several key aspects you should be aware of to ensure a successful venture.

[If this got your brain running and you want to make some extra cash, sign up as a host on Airbnb using my special code (get an incentive too)😉 https://www.airbnb.co.in/r/prekshac79?s=6&t=061n1v]

  1. HOSPITALITY is the baseline: A property is Real Estate, but as soon as you start to ‘Airbnb’ on it, you are in a customer-centric business
    This means your service needs to have — quick responses to queries, prompt address of any unwanted issues for a smooth stay AND a heartfelt thank you note on checkouts. Happy guests = happy business
  2. A STELLAR LISTING will make all the difference: Your Airbnb listing is your online storefront.
    You must create an eye-catching listing with high-quality photos, engaging descriptions, and comprehensive amenities. Highlighting unique features like a stunning view or proximity to popular attractions can make your potential guests click the ‘reserve now’ button.

items.title: GOA Airbnb Laws: What Hosts Need to Know [2024]
items.author: Preksha Chand
items.description:
Goa, the beach town of India and a go-to chill place has travellers seeking personal and cozy accommodations over the traditional hotel stay.

However, with the rise of short-term rentals, the Government of Goa has set specific legal frameworks to ensure community safety, compliance, and fairness for all.

This blog post serves as a comprehensive guide for short-term rental hosts on navigating the sometimes confusing landscape of Goa Airbnb laws and regulations.

Airbnb Laws in Goa

The scope of running Airbnb in Goa is quite high. They yield a much higher return on investment.

However, the opportunity comes with a responsibility to learn and understand local laws designed to regulate short-term rentals in Goa. These laws aim to balance the benefits of STRs with the need to maintain community balance.

REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS

To operate an Airbnb in Goa, India, hosts need to comply with certain regulations and obtain the necessary licenses.

  • Airbnb hosts in Goa who offer rented/serviced apartments, bungalows, homestays, or bed and breakfast establishments must register with the Goa Department of Tourism under Category “D” of the Goa Registration of Tourist Trade Rules1.
  • To register, hosts must submit an application in Form XXIII along with required documents like ownership proof, trade tax receipt, etc. The registration certificate number must be displayed in the Airbnb listing.
    [You are required to display the registration certificate number in your listing]
  • Hosts must also obtain necessary licenses/NOCs from local authorities like Gram Panchayat, Electricity Dept, PWD, Coastal Zone Authority, Food & Drugs Dept, Excise Dept, Fire Dept, Pollution Control Board, etc. depending on the specific case

TAX IMPLICATIONS

Any income earned by a person who lists their property through Airbnb for hosting would be subject to the Income Tax law. This might be ‘Income from House Property’, ‘Profits and Gains from Business and Profession’, or ‘Income from other sources’, it depends on individual circumstances.

For hosts who are residents of India, they are required to provide their PAN (Permanent Account Number) to Airbnb for tax compliance.

  • As per the official site, Airbnb is obligated to deduct 1% of the gross earnings of Hosts who are residents of India, and remit these funds to the Indian tax authorities. If you don’t provide your PAN, Airbnb will withhold tax at the rate of 5%.
  • Goods & Services Tax (GST) of 0–28% is applicable on the accommodation charges including cleaning fees, with the rate varying based on the average nightly rate. Airbnb remits the entire GST collected from guests directly to the tax authorities for hosts below the GST registration threshold.

SAFETY AND HEALTH REGULATIONS

Short-term rental hosts in Goa [running Airbnb] need to ensure their property meets safety and health standards as per local regulations.

  • This may include requirements related to fire safety, septic tanks, pollution control, etc.
  • Hosts are required to maintain a register for guest check-in/check-out records, including passport details for foreign tourists. The details must be submitted in Form C to registration authorities within 24 hours of a foreigner’s arrival
  • Hosts are also required to submit a statistics containing details of the tourists residing in his hotel/other accommodation unit on a monthly basis before the 5th of the month following the month to which it pertains in Form XI

Recent Changes in Airbnb Laws in Goa

The landscape of Airbnb laws is ever-evolving.

In recent years, Goa, has made significant changes to its Airbnb regulations — introducing mandatory registrations of the homestays, signing of a MoU between Airbnb and Department of Tourism, GOI are some of the latest leaps taken for the hosts.

These changes were introduced to address issues such as housing shortages and neighborhood disruptions.

Staying informed about these changes is key to maintaining a compliant and successful hosting operation.

COMPLIANCE TIPS FOR SHORT-TERM RENTAL HOSTS

To ensure you’re running a compliant Airbnb business, here are some quick tips:

  • Thoroughly research and secure the necessary licenses or permits.
  • Stay updated about any changes in local laws regarding STRs.
  • Keep accurate records of your income and tax payments.
  • Ensure your property meets all safety and health requirements.
  • Communicate transparently with your guests about what they can expect.

In Conclusion..

The future of Airbnb looks promising in Goa; however hosts has a duty to stay informed and compliant with the current laws. This way, hosts can contribute positively to the local community and economy while providing a unique and personal experience for visitors.

Utilise Airbnb’s own host resources & local government websites to seek out information that can greatly alleviate the regulatory burden.

Have a property? Rent it out! And more so — maximize your earnings through the magic of SHORT-TERM RENTALS

  • Is Airbnb a viable business?
  • What is the Return on Investment?
  • Different types of Airbnb models

  • Practical Tips from a Seasoned Host
Why should you read this article?
I have been managing Akshat Shrivastava’s Airbnbs in Goa for a year and have made >50% in profit while giving him a yield of 8%.
You can check out the listings and reviews here: https://www.airbnb.co.in/users/show/533280454

Is Airbnb a [logistically] SENSIBLE business?

Just because there is an uprising trend in a certain business doesn’t mean it is always viable. You must understand the fundamentals of a business before you decide to dive into it.

If you want to start an Airbnb, understand its use case:

  1. Personal perspective:
    Traveling with a family or a group typically makes Airbnb the preferable choice over hotels because of the cost-effectiveness and additional amenities, including privacy. The use case here is CONVENIENCE
    [A single decent hotel room in Goa can cost you approx Rs. 3,500 — Rs. 4,000/night whereas putting a little extra for this Unit will get you the comforts of a homestay]
  2. From a business POV:
    Operationally, running multiple properties on STRs doesn’t mean you have to manage each one personally. One approach is outsourcing management to skilled Airbnb managers [more on this later].

But to calculate ROI, you have to understand the math, and more importantly, the rental yield aspect

Rental Yield = (Annual rental income / Property value) x 100

Let’s run some numbers:

For a Rs. 2 Crore flat in Mumbai/Delhi, the average long-term lease rent will be Rs. 50,000/month. This makes an annual yield of 3%

This flat in Majorda is on Airbnb and commands on average a daily rent of Rs. 5,000.

If we take a conservative 200-day occupancy, the revenue generated from this flat would be more than Rs. 10,00,000 in a year. At a purchase value of Rs. 70L, the rental yield comes out to be 14.2%!

From a business viewpoint, short-term rentals yield higher returns than long-term leases. Therefore, it presents a good opportunity for daily rentals and maximizing your yields.

Analyzing the profit potential

With such lucrative numbers, you might be tempted to zoom into the STR world. But is it profitable? Can you turn running an Airbnb into your primary job?

The ROI aspect of running an Airbnb depends upon a lot of factors:
1. Location of your property
2. Trend of STR in the place
3. Average rental expected

To contextualize in Goan market:
A good villa can cost in the range of Rs. 2CR to 10CR, and can get an average rent of Rs. 10,000/night. On running the numbers, this would get a yield of 8–9%

Please note: This yield does not account for underlying property appreciation.

To put it in simple words:
If you buy a good property in Goa and put it on Airbnb, you will get returns in the form of:
A higher rental yield + Underlying property appreciation

Some additional points:
1. Take advantage of ‘LEVERAGING’: Even if you don’t have enough cash, you can finance a good property by taking a loan. [Bonus point: If it is ready to move, you can start getting the rent and adjust it against EMI :)]

2. Don’t be stuck on a villa/trendy property: There are always good options available for a low ticket. 2BHK apartments or studio apartments, if bought at a sensible price can again give you a good yield

With a decent amount of savings, you can start your Airbnb game.

Models of Operating an Airbnb

If you want to get into the Airbnb game, there are 3 models of operation:

  1. Buy → Build → Operate:
    You buy a land;
    You build on it;
    You run it as STR;
    From acquiring the land to running the business, you will have to be constantly involved in getting the documentation right and managing the team
  2. Buy → Operate / Buy → Lease
    You buy a readymade property;
    You run it as a short-term rental [OR] you lease it out to an Airbnb manager. These managers either charge you a commission or give you a monthly rental and look into the nitty-gritty of STR.
  3. Don’t buy → Operate
    This model doesn't require substantial upfront capital; the idea is to maximize properties that are currently not meeting their potential.
    Here, your USP will be a robust operating plan for running Airbnb to generate an alpha for you.
    [For example: Optimise your revenue by targeting a 250-day occupancy, this is where you will make the profits]

[Want to get into the Airbnb world? Set up an account on Airbnb through my referral, you’ll get money to join too 😉 ]

Markets for Airbnb

To choose where you should start with your STR business, you must consider important factors:

  1. Location: There should be a good market demand for STRs. This can be a tourist hub [such as Goa, Lonavla] or professionals looking for short-stays [such as Bangalore]
  2. Competitive Advantage: If you want to do well in the STR game, you must have a competitive advantage on your property. Buying an apartment where 100 new ones can be constructed can seriously sabotage your BNB prospect. Therefore, choose a place where the supply of such homestays can remain limited.
  3. Target Customers who go to premium locations: Just because a location is trending currently doesn’t mean it will continue in the future. Be wary of investing in such places as the future ROI might be below subpar.
  4. Regulatory and Legal Considerations: Understanding and complying with local regulations is crucial. These rules differ in every place.
    For instance, in Goa, operating a short-term rental business requires specific licenses that are vital to ensure legality and smooth operation.
    Important: If your property is in a society, you need to obtain a ‘No-Objection Certificate’ from the society and know the minute details to run your rentals there.

Airbnb in Goa

“I don't live in Goa but I want to buy/run an Airbnb there. Is it worth it? And can I do that?”

Goa, as a tourist hub state, checks all the points discussed above;
The market is suitable for STR, guests are in and out of Goa all year round, tourism board encourages people for short-term rental by giving a tourism license, etc.

And, since the market is not yet saturated, underlying property appreciation [especially in South Goa] is approx 5–6% p.a.

Coupled with a higher STR return, the overall yield becomes quite attractive.

The cherry on top:
You don’t have to be in Goa to run your airbnb. Establish systems and have trustworthy people to manage the onground work and you can reap the benefits :)

Practical Management Tips from a Seasoned Host

Running an Airbnb efficiently requires attention to detail and a focus on guest experience. Pay attention to the basics and you can ace this game:

Following these tips can help you easily navigate this journey:

  • Legal Compliance: Ensuring all operations are within legal boundaries to avoid future complications. In Goa, you need to have a Goa tourism license to list your property on Airbnb
  • Quality and Cleanliness: Maintaining high standards of cleanliness and property maintenance to enhance guest experience and encourage positive reviews.
  • Effective Marketing: Utilizing high-quality photos and detailed descriptions in listings to attract more guests.
  • Guest Communication: Providing excellent communication and customer service to enhance guest satisfaction and encourage repeat bookings.

Conclusion

Starting and scaling an Airbnb business can be a highly profitable venture if approached correctly. Property owners can significantly profit from this booming industry by understanding the market dynamics, legal requirements, and operational strategies and by focusing on providing excellent guest experiences. Whether you’re looking to manage or own properties, the flexibility and potential of the Airbnb platform offer a unique opportunity for savvy entrepreneurs to capitalize on the thriving tourism and short-term rental market.

items.title: Make more money from your property: Short-term rental [Airbnb]
items.author: Preksha Chand
items.description:
Own a property and want to rent it out?
Maximize your earnings through SHORT TERM RENTAL.

Gone are the days when you would only rely on a steady monthly income from your property. Today, the short-term market is booming at various places [from Goa, Shimla [in India], Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur, Hanoi, Paris, Rome, and anywhere and everywhere people travel].
These tourists look for a homestay for 2–5 nights instead of renting out a space for an entire month.

This helps them:
1. Get out of paying a huge deposit demanded by long-term rentals
2. Experience homely and unique stays while vacationing, and
3. Pay cheaper prices for more space and facilities

Such STRs have given property owners like Akshat Shrivastava [who runs his Airbnbs in Goa] a lucrative opportunity to make an 8–10% yield on their properties.

Platforms such as Airbnb can be the perfect place to enter this world.

1. Unlock Higher Rental Income

Since you are giving your space for a shorter time, you can command a higher nightly rate, thus essentially earning more income and maximizing your property’s financial performance.

This especially works wonders in places such as Goa where the tourist footfall is high.

Action step: Compare potential earnings from short-term rentals and traditional long-term leases in your area to see the difference.

[If you are interested in maximizing your property yield, you should set up an account on Airbnb and get into the world of STR, you’ll get money to join too 😉 ]

2. Set an Optimal Pricing Strategy

Renting your property as an STR, you have the control in your hands to change your pricing according to the demand, seasonality, and special events. This dynamic pricing strategy allows you to maximize your earnings throughout the year and adapt to market trends effectively.

Action step: Use dynamic pricing strategies to capitalize on trends and give discounts and incentives to maximize your earning potential.

3. Generate business income and make use of Tax Advantages

Running an Airbnb can prove to be beneficial from a tax-saving perspective. This income may offer tax advantages, including deductions for maintenance, utilities, and depreciation.

Further, if you have an Airbnb business, you can set up a company and claim business benefits that your tax residency might provide.

Action step: Consult with a professional CA/tax advisor to understand potential tax benefits and deductions available for running short-term rentals.

4. Create an exceptional experience of your stay

Your STR will work for you only if you work for it.
From making a good first impression with honest and high-quality photos to attract guests to providing great hospitality by empathizing with them, you must aim to make their experience worthwhile.

Happy guests are likelier to leave positive reviews and recommend your property to others. This means:
Increased visibility for your property → attract more bookings → maximize your rental earnings.

Action step: Put yourself in your guests' shoes to understand what they need. This will help you provide them with a better experience.

5. Learn marketing, maintenance, and all the related nuances

Airbnb platform is good to showcase your property to the world, but its not enough. If you want to maximize on your short-term rental earnings, you must PROMOTE it — through social media, word-of-mouth, networking etc.

Interact with your guests - give them a good experience and they can talk about it on Facebook/Instagram. These testimonials will help attract a wider audience

Action step: Market your property using social media tools, local networks, and Airbnb’s promotional tools to increase visibility.

The yield from your property can skyrocket with short-term rental options as provided by platforms like Airbnb. Study the market and understand the potential to make the best out of it :)

items.title: 3 life skills that my LAW SCHOOL taught me
items.author: Preksha Chand
items.description:
It is said: Undergraduate years are your foundational years.

And that is very true!

You leave your house at 18 and expose yourself to the world for the first time, outside the comfort of your parents' 24 hours care.

At every nook and corner, you experience something new — how people from different cultural backgrounds behave, how to buy things on your own, how to interact in a social group, etc.

You end up learning not only your academics but also some very crucial life skills that stay with you throughout your life.

As a law school undergrad, I learned 3 very important lessons that help me not only in my professional life but also personal:

It’s all in the details

Law is 15% concept and 85% interpretation. A tweak in the meaning of a single word can change the course of someone’s future.

An ‘agreement’ is a consensus but a ‘contract’ is legally binding — the former will not necessarily guarantee you a right in the courts.

Similarly, in life, small things matter as much as the big picture.

  • Your daily habits make up your discipline;
  • Your nutrient intake decides your health;
  • Your way of communication dictates your relationships;

A house can be grand, but the inside decor decides its vibe.

Your aim can be to become a CEO, but for that, you need to lay out the blueprint marking each plan of action.

Communication is the key

To have field knowledge is one thing. But to be able to express it is the ART.

Making a career in the legal field means you’ve got to have a stronghold of the concepts AS WELL AS know how to put your point across articulately.

[A single tweak in your sentence can cost your client thousands of dollars — ask Elon Musk:) ]

Strong communication skill helps in all aspects of life:

  • Your interactions with your boss make a mark on your promotion;
  • Your relationships revolve around how well you sort things out;
  • Your wants and desires will be met only when you express them properly;

It is a foundational skill that plays out in your daily routine.

Assimilation of information is critical

In this digital era, you can virtually know about anything and everything. A simple Google search will bombard you with loads of information.

But merely knowing stuff is not sufficient — you should be able to comprehend it.

Law degrees demand a lot of reading — fat textbooks, 100-pages case laws, and reiteration of your arguments. Pulling out the most relevant details while skimming through the masses becomes second nature.

In a world full of distractions, this skill can be a game changer for your professional growth.

An intense professional career path, a law degree not only catapults your career monetary-wise but also develops your personality and prepares you for every walk of life.
